snippet: Judge Anita B. Brody said she wants more proof that the $765 million in a proposed settlement for retired N.F.L. players will last 65 years.
abstract: Analysis; some legal experts say long silence following Judge Anita B Brody's temporary rejection of NFL's proposed $765 million settlement with retired players could indicate that details of the deal have not convinced her to change her decision; Brody is reviewing data to ensure that funds will cover players suffering from injury-related ailments for 65 years, or the life of the settlement.
lead_paragraph: Judge Anita B. Brody said she wants more proof that the $765 million in a proposed settlement for retired N.F.L. players will last 65 years.

headline.main: No Quick or Clear Solution in N.F.L. Settlement
headline.print_headline: No Quick or Clear Solution in N.F.L. Settlement
